content:
For the purpose of installing hugo, we need to install package manager - Chocolatey for Windows.
This article will introduce how to install Chocolatey in Windows environment.
Install Chocolatey First, go to the official web site of Chocolatey
Chocolatey official site
Chocolatey official site of install instruction
Install step 1. Using System Administrator to open Windows Power Shell The command needs Windows Power Shell to execute, remember using System Administrator to open Windows Power Shell
![fig2](/figures_for_install_chocolately/fig2.start_power_shell_with_admin.png “Fig2. Right click icon and select “Run as administrator” Windows Power Shell”)
Install step 2. Execute the command from Chocolatey install instruction According to Chocolatey install instruction, if you have some authority control issue, you better go to the MSDN to check which authority level you required.
To check the setting of your Power Shell, you can using the following command.
Get-ExecutionPolicy -list  Then you can run the “run following command”
Set-ExecutionPolicy Bypass -Scope Process -Force; [System.Net.ServicePointManager]::SecurityProtocol = [System.Net.ServicePointManager]::SecurityProtocol -bor 3072; iex ((New-Object System.Net.WebClient).DownloadString('https://community.chocolatey.org/install.ps1'))  Note that command has written the “Bypass”, so your Set-ExecutionPolicy will be set to Bypass, -Scope Process means only applied for Process
Using “AllSigned” will get multiple queries, it depends on your needs to decide using Bypass or AllSigned, I’m just lazy person so I just using Bypass.
After finished, you will see Chocolatey (choco.exe) is now ready.
title: Install Chocolatey in Windows
